diskUtilities

Class DiskUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • diskUtilities.DiskUnit

  • public class DiskUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the virtual disk, takes care of its creation, parameters, free block, directory and inode.
    Author:
    Israel J.Lopez Toledo

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiskUnit

        public DiskUnit(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the disk

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Simulates shutting-off the disk. Just closes the corresponding RAF and saves important disk parameters in block 0. If program is closed and this method was not executed the disk is compromised and should be deleted.

      • mount

        public static DiskUnit mount(java.lang.String name)
                      throws NonExistingDiskException
        Turns on an existing disk unit whose name is given. If successful, it makes the particular disk unit available for operations suitable for a disk unit. And retrieves current disk parameters
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the disk unit to activate
        Returns:
        the corresponding DiskUnit object
        Throws:
        NonExistingDiskException - whenever no ¨disk¨ with the specified name is found.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ExistingDiskException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as having default capacity (number of blocks), each of default size (number of bytes). Those values are: DEFAULT_CAPACITY and DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE. The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name,
                                  int capacity,
                                  int blockSize)
                           throws ExistingDiskException,
                                  java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as with the specified capacity (number of blocks), each of specified size (number of bytes). The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        capacity - number of blocks in the new disk
        blockSize - size per block in the new disk
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - whenever the values for capacity or blockSize are not valid according to the specifications

      • write

        public void write(int blockNum,
                  VirtualDiskBlock b)
           throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                  InvalidBlockException
        Writes the content in the given block instance directly into the specified disk block.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - index of the specific block in the disk where the content of the given block will be written
        b - block instance with the content to be written in the disk
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever the block number attempted is not a valid one.
        InvalidBlockException - whenever the block instance attempted does not match the block size of the current disk instance

      • read

        public void read(int blockNum,
                 VirtualDiskBlock b)
          throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                 InvalidBlockException
        Reads a given block from the disk. The content of the specified disk block is copied as the new content of the current instance block.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - index of the specific block in the disk that contains the data to be read
        b - block instance where the content to be read will be copied and read from
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever the block number attempted is not a valid one.
        InvalidBlockException - whenever the block instance attempted does not match the block size of the current disk instance

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns:
        a nonnegative integer value corresponding to the number of valid blocks that the current disk instance has.

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Returns:
        nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the size of a block in the current disk instance.

      • lowLevelFormat

        public void lowLevelFormat()
        Formats the disk. This operation visits every “physical block”, except block 0, in the disk and fills with zeroes all those blocks.

      • setInode

        public void setInode(int index,
                     int size,
                     int firstBlock)
        Modifies specified iNode. This method is used at file creation.
        Parameters:
        index - iNode index
        size - size of file
        firstBlock - posistion of the file's first block

      • setInode

                     int size)
        Modifies the file size the i node is holding
        Parameters:
        index - inode's index
        size - size of file

      • pushDir

        public void pushDir(int inodeIndex)
        push current directory inode to stack, this is to preserve the directories order while moving through directories
        Parameters:
        inodeIndex - inode index of current directory

      • pushName

        public void pushName(java.lang.String name)
        push current directory path name, this is to preserve the directories path name order while moving forward through directories
        Parameters:
        name - current directory path name

      • popDir

        public int popDir()
           throws EmptyStackException
        pop stack to obtain previous directory inode index, this is to preserve the directories order while moving backwards through directories
        Returns:
        previous directory inode index, returns -1 if stack is empty
        Throws:
        EmptyStackException

      • getDiskName

        public java.lang.String getDiskName()
        Returns:
        get name of current disk

      • popName

        public java.lang.String popName()
                         throws EmptyStackException
        pop stack to obtain previous directory path name, this is to preserve the directories path name order while moving backwards through directories
        Returns:
        previous directory path name, returns null if stack is empty
        Throws:
        EmptyStackException

      • deleteDisk

        public static boolean deleteDisk(java.lang.String names)
        Attempts to delete specified disk.
        Parameters:
        names - file's name
        Returns:
        true or false depending on file deletion success

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • registerFB

        public void registerFB(int bn)
        Registers blocks that are no longer in use as free blocks
        Parameters:

      • addTodirectory

        public void addTodirectory(int sizeD,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           int Node)
        Adds file information to directory and connects every directory block so that it can be read later as a single file
        Parameters:
        name - files name
        sizeD - directory current size
        Node - files inode index to write on block
